articles.author: Aurelien Breeden and Elian Peltier
articles.title: French Chef Loses Legal Battle Over a Lost Michelin Star
articles.description: Marc Veyrat was outraged when La Maison des Bois, his restaurant in the French Alps, was stripped of the guide’s top rating.
articles.content:
Of the thousands of restaurants around France listed in the 2019 guide, only 27 received three stars.
La Maison des Bois, which is coupled with a five-star hotel, has stunning views of the Alps, including Mont Blanc. Mr. Veyrat has said he mostly uses local … [+1142 chars]

articles.author: Robert D. McFadden
articles.title: Sonny Mehta, Venerable Knopf Publisher, Is Dead at 77
articles.description: Mr. Mehta was a voracious reader and instinctive decision maker who could spot great books and, coming from a paperback world, had no qualms about pushing them.
articles.content: Sonny Mehta, the literary savant who guided the reading hours of millions and the fortunes of the venerable publisher Alfred A. Knopf for 32 years at a time of changing tastes, aggressive merchandising and demands for profits, died on Monday at his home in Ma… [+835 chars]

articles.title: Tiny Love Stories: A New Year’s Instagram Flirtation
articles.description: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.
articles.content: Despite an impending New Years blizzard, I drove my little Honda to the Hamptons to visit a friend. We got cabin fever, both wanting to be somewhere else for the holiday, and drove back to the city before they closed the roads. We passed cars stuck like Lego … [+270 chars]

articles.author: Neil MacFarquhar
articles.title: Mourning Iraq’s Destruction, a Native Son Creates
articles.description: Dia al-Azzawi, a Baghdad-born artist, weaves antiquity, poetry and messages of resistance at MoMA PS1.
articles.content:
Mr. Azzawi promised to buy the works.
I have an incredible collection, he said, and has refused to sell them. More than 30 are in the show.
Most address the toll of war and occupation, like the heavy concrete blast walls that sliced through Baghdad or the M… [+1137 chars]

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Sonny Mehta, Visionary Head of Alfred A. Knopf, Dies at 77
articles.description: Sonny Mehta, the urbane and astute head of Alfred A. Knopf who guided one of the book world's most esteemed imprints to new heights through a blend of prize-winning literature by Toni Morrison and Cormac McCarthy among others and blockbusters such as "Fifty S…
articles.content: An accomplished publisher and editor since his mid-20s, he succeeded the revered Robert Gottlieb in 1987 as just the third Knopf editor-in-chief in its 72-year history and over the following decades fashioned his own record of critical and commercial success.… [+2857 chars]

articles.author: Jill Cowan
articles.title: The Biggest California Stories in 2019
articles.description: Tuesday: A look back at the year in the Golden State. Also: Uber and Postmates sue over a new law; and a thank you.
articles.content: Jose Del Real: Crossing between Mexico and the United States is an everyday practice for people living in the border towns of the Southwest. But for transgender women like Jess Enriquez Taylor, who is Mexican but grew up in the United States and has a green c… [+1900 chars]

articles.author: Vivian Yee and Hwaida Saad
articles.title: Carlos Ghosn, Prodigal Son and Fugitive, Returns to Beirut
articles.description: For many residents, he represents the Lebanese dream, of leaving the country and becoming a success.
articles.content:
Ever since, Mr. Ghosn has lived the Lebanese dream. If the Lebanese are not, as the billboards had it, all Carlos Ghosn, there were many who may have wanted to be. 
Generations of Lebanese have left the country, fleeing civil war, instability and an economy … [+1994 chars]

articles.author: Kevin Granville
articles.title: All About Carlos Ghosn, the Former Auto Titan Who Fled Japan
articles.description: He built a global automotive empire. After he was arrested by the police, he challenged — and then ducked — the Japanese legal system.
articles.content: Mr. Ghosn, 65, was once the epitome of the world-straddling corporate executive. He ran a global car empire as the architect and chief of the Renault-Nissan-Mitsubishi automaking alliance. By slashing costs and creating efficiencies, Renault of France and Nis… [+1357 chars]
